info.game_comments: Introduction of Clue Crew member Jimmy.

(1, 1).clue: In "Earth Movers", the prototype of this modern machine is described here

(2, 1).clue: A long-running campaign shows fabulous places that "Don't Take" this credit card

(3, 1).clue: Ernie's roommate, he collects paper clips

(5, 1).clue: Though Michigan had a single-sex dorm known as "The Virgin Vault", this "Material Girl" lived in East Quad

(6, 1).clue: In a guessing game you might ask "Is it bigger or smaller than" this kitchen item

(1, 2).clue: On "Power Tools", this comedian muses, "There isn't a guy I know that doesn't say more horsepower would be better"

(2, 2).clue: A Sports Illustrated subscription drive popularized the phrase "The Gift That" does this

(3, 2).clue: Originally a backstage worker on "The Muppet Show", Rizzo is one of these animals

(5, 2).clue: Before intoning "This is CNN", it was U of M for this man who overcame a childhood stutter

(6, 2).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew reports from the L.A. County Museum of Natural History.)  I'm standing between two dueling dinosaurs: a triceratops & this carnivore

(1, 3).clue: The episode seen here is devoted to this development

(2, 3).clue: The following clip dramatizes a famous cartoon ad for this man's products

(3, 3).clue: We're not sure what the creature seen here is, but we do know his girlfriend Camilla is one of these birds

(5, 3).clue: The "salesman" he created wouldn't die until 11 years after this author's senior year in 1938

(6, 3).clue: It's the state capital whose flag is seen here

(1, 4).clue: It's the item described here, as improved by blacksmith William Dimmit

(2, 4).clue: This company took us for a ride with "It's Such a Comfort to Take the Bus and Leave the Driving to Us"

(3, 4).clue: Dr. Teeth & Rowlf play this instrument

(5, 4).clue: It'd take more than "60 Minutes" to honor this anchor/alum, also a character in "The Insider"

(6, 4).clue: In Monopoly, if you land on this space that has a diamond ring on it, you'll have to pay $75

(2, 5).clue: Ridley Scott directed the "Share the Fantasy" ads for this tony perfume

(3, 5).clue: One of the two phrases that begin with "Hi" associated with the Muppets seen here

(5, 5).clue: Lawrence Kasdan wrote this Kevin Kline/Glenn Close ensemble film partially based on his years at Michigan

(6, 5).clue: Agate with bands of white & brown, black or red is often referred to by this name

(2, 1).clue: Richard Dreyfuss can be spotted (if you're attentive) in the 1967 version of this Jacqueline Susann book

(3, 1).clue: Tree-mendous seat of Pitkin County, Colorado

(4, 1).clue: Part of the body on which you would normally wear a kappie

(5, 1).clue: Altdorf, Switzerland boasts a statue of this archer with his son, the "apple" of his eye

(6, 1).clue: Zapata's Plan of Ayala called for redistribution of land to indigenous people in this country

(1, 2).clue: "The Tempest", act V, scene 1, line 183 by Huxley

(3, 2).clue: In California, Marysville is the seat of Yuba & Yuba City is the seat of this county named for a mill owner

(4, 2).clue: To an Afrikaaner, a klipspringer, like a reebok, is one of these

(5, 2).clue: The Telecom Tower on Black Mountain in this Aussie capital boasts a revolving restaurant

(6, 2).clue: In December 1946 this country rejected the USA's Baruch Plan for international control of atomic energy

(1, 3).clue: "Macbeth", act V, scene v, line 26 by Faulkner

(4, 3).clue: To an Afrikaaner, this city is Kaapstad

(5, 3).clue: Disney has announced plans to build a theme park in this former crown colony on China's southern coast

(6, 3).clue: Favoring moderate terms for reconstruction, he vetoed the Wade-Davis Plan in 1864

(1, 4).clue: "Richard III", Act 1, scene 1, line 1 by Steinbeck

(2, 4).clue: Mel Gibson makes a punked-out cameo in this 1997 Robin Williams-Billy Crystal comedy

(4, 4).clue: This one should be easy to field: this grassland's name is from the Dutch for "field"

(5, 4).clue: (Sofia of the Clue Crew reports from Sea World in San Diego.)  This spiny sea creature that I'm holding is on a lot of menus in Martinique, where it's known as oursin

(6, 4).clue: The plan of colonial union named for this city in New York called for a grand council & a president general

(2, 5).clue: When this future TV angel appeared in 1974's "Evil in the Deep" she was billed as Cheryl Stoppelmoor

(4, 5).clue: This 11-letter term for a South African pioneer refers back to the Boers who made that long walk

(5, 5).clue: It's fun to ride the aerial tramway from Manhattan to this East River island; catch it at 2nd Avenue & 59th Street

(6, 5).clue: The Marshall Plan is more formally known as the ERP or this "program"

(0, 0).clue: It's the reason that airlines altered many of their transpacific flight plans on March 23, 2001
